html: Two decades ago today, 12 students and one teacher were shot and killed, and almost twice as many were wounded at Columbine High School. We commit to honoring the Columbine community and all gun violence survivors by continuing to advocate for stronger gun safety laws.pic.twitter.com/zu3RLfl0OT
text:
Two decades ago today, 12 students and one teacher were shot and killed, and almost twice as many were wounded at Columbine High School.

We commit to honoring the Columbine community and all gun violence survivors by continuing to advocate for stronger gun safety laws.pic.twitter.com/zu3RLfl0OT

html: America was founded by refugees. We should not close our borders, our shores, or our hearts to them. Today, @RepZoeLofgren, @RepJoeNeguse and I are introducing the GRACE Act to prevent a U.S. President from setting refugee admissions a level below 95,000 in a given year.pic.twitter.com/StfT7mL7Th
text: America was founded by refugees. We should not close our borders, our shores, or our hearts to them. Today, @RepZoeLofgren, @RepJoeNeguse and I are introducing the GRACE Act to prevent a U.S. President from setting refugee admissions a level below 95,000 in a given year.pic.twitter.com/StfT7mL7Th

html: The United States has long welcomed those who seek safety and refuge in trying times and the GRACE Act will ensure America’s bedrock commitment to uplifting those who need us the most is upheld.https://neguse.house.gov/media/press-releases/reps-neguse-lofgren-and-senator-markey-introduce-legislation-welcome-refugees …
text: The United States has long welcomed those who seek safety and refuge in trying times and the GRACE Act will ensure America’s bedrock commitment to uplifting those who need us the most is upheld.https://neguse.house.gov/media/press-releases/reps-neguse-lofgren-and-senator-markey-introduce-legislation-welcome-refugees …

html: Today, I joined @RepZoeLofgren & @SenMarkey to introduce the GRACE Act, legislation that will prevent a U.S. President from slashing refugee admission numbers, as President Trump has done. We must uphold our commitment to the most vulnerable people around the world.
text: Today, I joined @RepZoeLofgren & @SenMarkey to introduce the GRACE Act, legislation that will prevent a U.S. President from slashing refugee admission numbers, as President Trump has done. We must uphold our commitment to the most vulnerable people around the world.

html: Women are the sole or co-breadwinner in half of American families with children. Simply paying them fairly can lift millions of families out of poverty. It’s past time to end gender-based wage discrimination and pay women what they deserve. #EqualPayforEqualWork
text: Women are the sole or co-breadwinner in half of American families with children. Simply paying them fairly can lift millions of families out of poverty. It’s past time to end gender-based wage discrimination and pay women what they deserve. #EqualPayforEqualWork

html: It’s 2019 and women still make, on average, 80 cents for every dollar earned by a man. Today, we’re helping to end gender-based wage discrimination by passing the Paycheck Fairness Act. #EqualPayForEqualWork

About 1.6 BILLION ppl—including >2,000 indigenous cultures—depend on forests for their livelihoods, medicines, fuel, food and shelter.

text: #HR8 just passed the U.S. House! I'm proud to support the first major gun violence prevention legislation in years. This is the first step we need to move our nation to action and #EndGunViolence and I urge my colleagues in the Senate to support it.

html: I joined 100+ @MomsDemand volunteers in DC today to support the House vote for #HR8. html: In Colorado, we understand the value of our public lands. Our state’s outdoor recreation economy brings in $28 billion, $10 billion in workers’ wages alone. Investing in our public lands, conserving our wild places is good for our economy and for our future generations.
text: In Colorado, we understand the value of our public lands. Our state’s outdoor recreation economy brings in $28 billion, $10 billion in workers’ wages alone. Investing in our public lands, conserving our wild places is good for our economy and for our future generations.

html: To all the Dreamers across Colorado: keep up the fight. Our state and country benefit greatly from your courage and dedication. I will do my part in Congress to ensure we pass permanent protections that will allow you to work, drive, and live free from the fear of deportation!
text: To all the Dreamers across Colorado: keep up the fight. Our state and country benefit greatly from your courage and dedication. I will do my part in Congress to ensure we pass permanent protections that will allow you to work, drive, and live free from the fear of deportation!

html: #DACA recipients are integral to communities across Colorado, which is why I will continue to work to ensure that Dreamers and their family members can thrive. Their dedication and contributions are good for Colorado’s economy and our future.
text: #DACA recipients are integral to communities across Colorado, which is why I will continue to work to ensure that Dreamers and their family members can thrive. Their dedication and contributions are good for Colorado’s economy and our future.

html: I met a mother with #TPS who arrived in the United States in 2001 after an earthquake struck El Salvador. She's now an integral part of her community in Colorado.

html: Trump is declaring a national emergency to bypass Congress, to build a wall we don’t need, to address a crisis that doesn’t exist, by claiming an authority he doesn’t have. If that sounds like nonsense, it’s because it is. It’s also plainly unconstitutional.
text:
Trump is declaring a national emergency to bypass Congress, to build a wall we don’t need, to address a crisis that doesn’t exist, by claiming an authority he doesn’t have.
 
If that sounds like nonsense, it’s because it is. It’s also plainly unconstitutional.

html: This is plainly a power grab by a disappointed President, who has gone outside the bounds of the law to try to get what he failed to achieve in the constitutional legislative process.
text: This is plainly a power grab by a disappointed President, who has gone outside the bounds of the law to try to get what he failed to achieve in the constitutional legislative process.

html: To implement the President's plan, the military would need to seize hundreds of miles of land from private citizens, border states and tribes. This is a flagrant abuse of power and a direct assault on the separation of powers.

html: I’m excited that 2 pieces of legislation I’ve introduced – the Bolts Ditch Access & Use Act & the WEDGE Act– are both included in the Senate’s public lands package passed last night. I'm ready to take them up in the House and hopeful that we’ll see them passed into law shortly!

text:
If you are wondering why there’s been so little action on lowering the price of prescription drugs, look at the Big Pharma lobbyists.

PhRMA has spent $210 million lobbying Congress over the past decade.

Campaign finance reform is essential to the demand for lower drug prices.

text:
So let me get this straight.

- On Dec. 19, Senate passes a short-term CR funding the gov. until Feb. 8
- Trump demands $5 billion for a wall.
- In his last act of cowardice, @SpeakerRyan doesn't bring the Senate bill up, and instead brings one up with wall money.
- We shut down.

html: Typically a president starts the State of the Union address by saying, “The state of our union is strong.” Does Trump really want to start his off by saying, “The state of our union is...closed.” Reopen the government, Mr. President. Citizens first. Ceremony later.
text:
Typically a president starts the State of the Union address by saying, “The state of our union is strong.”
 
Does Trump really want to start his off by saying, “The state of our union is...closed.”
 
Reopen the government, Mr. President. Citizens first. Ceremony later.
